title: Khalkha Mongols
summary: The Khalkha (Mongolian: Халх, Halh, Mongolian pronunciation: [xɑɮx]) is the largest subgroup of Mongol people[2] in modern Mongolia since the 15th century. The Khalkha, together with Chahars, Ordos and Tumed, were directly ruled by Borjigin khans until the 20th century; unlike the Oirats, who were ruled by Dzungar nobles or the Khorchins, who were ruled by Qasar's descendants.
